item.title: Swedish Krona Falls to Multi-Year Low Vs Euro After Riksbank Raises Rates by 25Bps
item.description: The Swedish krona fell to its weakest level in more than a decade after the Riksbank raised its policy rate by 25 basis points to 3.75%, disappointing some in the market who had anticipated a 50bp rise.

item.title: Oil Edges Lower; U.S. Crude Stocks Slump
item.description: Crude futures inched lower as investors took profits following Wednesday’s sharp run-up, but investors remained concerned about the impact of rising interest rates on oil demand.

item.title: Metals Sour as Dollar Rises on Central-Bank Hawkishness
item.description: Base metals and gold edged lower, with the economic environment turning more bearish “via a strong dollar, softer inflation expectations, and weaker commodity currencies,” Peak Trading Research said.

item.title: Casino Proposes Debt Restructuring
item.description: Casino said it would be necessary to convert debt totaling around €5 billion into capital in order to have a structure compatible with its business plan, and would mean Rallye losing control of the grocer.

item.title: H&M's Mixed 2Q Saw Gross Margin Miss But Ebit Beat and Strong June
item.description: H&M B shares opened up 8% after the retailer posted second-quarter earnings, with gross margin slightly below expectations but EBIT well ahead, due to better-than-expected cost control and good trading in June, RBC Capital Markets said.

item.title: Renault Upgrades Outlook
item.description: Renault said its trading had been better than expected as it revised its 2023 operating margin to 7-8% and its automotive operational free cash flow to at least €2.5 billion.

item.title: U.S. Companies Face EU Deforestation Rules on Coffee, Wood and More
item.description: Businesses selling everyday products such as leather shoes, coffee and chocolate in the EU will soon need to prove their wares aren’t causing forest loss under a new law, after voluntary efforts largely failed.

item.title: H&M Posts Profit Beat, Sees Good Start to Summer
item.description: H&M said its fiscal third quarter got off to a good start thanks to well-received summer collections after it posted second-quarter profits ahead of forecast.

item.title: Eurozone Bond Yields Rise as Upside Risks Seen in German CPI Data
item.description: Eurozone government bond yields edged higher, with the focus on German inflation data, said UniCredit Research, which expects to see yield curve flattening if the CPI surprises to the upside.

item.title: Jerome Powell Says Bank Failures Underscore Need for Stronger Regulation, Supervision
item.description: The Fed chair says he “looks forward to evaluating proposals for such changes.”

item.title: Analysis: Yen May Weaken Further as Interest Rates Diverge
item.description: The yen may weaken more in coming months on expectations that the interest-rate gap between Japan and most other countries could widen further and hurt the Japanese currency, analysts said.

item.title: Netanyahu said he would drop one of the most controversial parts of his plan to remake Israel's court system, stripping it of a provision that would have given the national legislature the power to overturn Supreme Court rulings.
item.description: Netanyahu said he would drop one of the most controversial parts of his plan to remake Israel’s court system, stripping it of a provision that would have given the national legislature the power to overturn Supreme Court rulings.

item.title: Prosecutors are investigating whether a securities broker and his associates traded on information illegally obtained from Morgan Stanley about planned M&A, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.description: Prosecutors are investigating whether a securities broker and his associates traded on information illegally obtained from Morgan Stanley about planned M&A, according to people familiar with the matter.

item.title: Biden touted "Bidenomics" in a Chicago speech, part of a messaging blitz aimed at turning around perceptions of Americans who disapprove of his handling of the economy.
item.description: Biden touted “Bidenomics” in a Chicago speech, part of a messaging blitz aimed at turning around perceptions of Americans who disapprove of his handling of the economy.

item.title: The Chinese spy balloon that floated over the U.S. early this year was loaded with American-made equipment that helped it collect photos, videos and other information, U.S. officials said.
item.description: The Chinese spy balloon that floated over the U.S. early this year was loaded with American-made equipment that helped it collect photos, videos and other information, U.S. officials said.

item.title: General Mills said sales took a hit in its most recently completed quarter as volumes continue to weaken and retailers trim their inventories.
item.description: General Mills said sales took a hit in its most recently completed quarter as volumes continue to weaken and retailers trim their inventories.

item.title: A jump in Apple and Tesla shares pushed the Nasdaq 0.3% higher, while the S&P 500 and the Dow slipped 0.04% and 0.2%, respectively.
item.description: A jump in Apple and Tesla shares pushed the Nasdaq 0.3% higher, while the S&P 500 and the Dow slipped 0.04% and 0.2%, respectively.

item.title: FTX is moving ahead with plans to restart its flagship international cryptocurrency exchange, an effort that will face major challenges as regulators ratchet up their oversight of the industry and the company works its way through bankruptcy proceedings.
item.description: FTX is moving ahead with plans to restart its flagship international cryptocurrency exchange, an effort that will face major challenges as regulators ratchet up their oversight of the industry and the company works its way through bankruptcy proceedings.

item.title: The man who placed Jordan Neely in afatal chokehold on a New York City subwaypleaded not guilty to criminal charges.
item.description: The man who placed Jordan Neely in a fatal chokehold on a New York City subway pleaded not guilty to criminal charges.

item.title: Nvidia's CFO warned of possible severe long-term consequences from potential new restrictions on the sale of artificial-intelligence semiconductors to China.
item.description: Nvidia’s CFO warned of possible severe long-term consequences from potential new restrictions on the sale of artificial-intelligence semiconductors to China.
